title: Social Security Assurance and Teacher Training in Vocational Education: Applying Problem-Based Activity-Centered Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Core vocational education concepts and general understanding of teaching roles
context.additional_context: Targets professionals in healthcare, law, or technology with beginner-level domain expertise in social safety assurance and teacher training. Requires support for limited technological environments via smartphone utilization.

learning_goals: Learners can apply core elements of social safety assurance (mental self-regulation, stress tolerance, critical thinking, etc.) to real educational contexts.
Learners can analyze conflict cases that may occur in vocational education settings and propose resolution strategies through problem-based learning.
Learners can design and demonstrate teacher role models (communication skills, ethical decision-making, etc.) for ensuring social safety using activity-centered instructional methods.

resources: Offline collaboration tools (flipcharts, Post-it notes, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
